Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani launched a three-run homer for the Los Angeles Dodgers that punctuated their 8-0 victory over the New York Mets in Game 3 of the National League Championship Series.
Enrique Hernández hit a two-run shot to make it 4-0 in the sixth inning.
Max Muncy went deep in the ninth for his 13th career postseason homer, tying Corey Seager and Justin Turner for the franchise record.
A fired-up Walker Buehler struck out Francisco Lindor to leave the bases loaded in the second.
Tommy Edman had a sacrifice fly that could have been more if not for a sensational catch on the right-center warning track by Tyrone Taylor.
Pre-Game Insights: The $700m superstar sparked the offense in Game 1 against the Mets, but hadn’t gone deep since hitting a three-run homer early in the Division Series opener.
Post-Match Reflections: Mets starter Luis Severino fell behind 2-0 in the second, partly due to some shoddy fielding.
With runners on, he is 7 for 9 with two homers and eight RBIs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ohtani pointed toward the Dodgers dugout when he connected on an 0-1 cutter from Tylor Megill in the eighth.
When he connected on an 0-1 cutter from Tylor Megill in the eighth, Ohtani pointed toward the Dodgers dugout. The ball was initially called fair, a ruling that stood following a replay review.
